titleStmt.title: This is for you who are called the Comon-vvealths-men [sic] both in the Army and Parliament to read. Wherein are many plain and true things declared unto you (which are suitable to your present estate and condition) that that [sic] ye may consider them in the same that they are sent unto you in, which is in truth, and in sincerity, and singlenesse and uprightnesse of heart, in that love which thinks no evil, even in obedience unto the spirit of the Lord, which also saith, try all things, and hold fast that which is good. / Given forth by George Fox the younger.
titleStmt.author: Fox, George, d. 1661.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Thomas Simmons, at the Bull and Mouth near Aldersgate,

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: G.F. = George Fox.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
